perturbation.original_text: Aduro shall pay Consultant any amounts due that are not reasonably disputed by Aduro, by check or direct bank deposit, within thirty days after receiving the invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: Aduro shall pay Consultant any amounts due that are not reasonably disputed by Aduro, by check or direct bank deposit, within sixty days after receiving the invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that payments will be made within sixty days of receiving the invoice, conflicting with the original clause specifying thirty days.

perturbation.original_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time on prior written notice to the other.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time on prior written notice of sixty (60) days to the other.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction by requiring a 60-day notice for termination, conflicting with the original clause which states termination can occur at any time with 'prior written notice', implying a shorter, unspecified timeframe.

perturbation.original_text: From the Effective Date and for twelve (12) months after the termination of this Agreement (the "Restricted Period"), Consultant shall not, without Aduro's prior written consent, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage any employee or contractor of Aduro or its affiliates to terminate employment with, or cease providing Services to, Aduro or its affiliates.
perturbation.changed_text: From the Effective Date and for six (6) months after the termination of this Agreement (the "Restricted Period"), Consultant shall not, without Aduro's prior written consent, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage any employee or contractor of Aduro or its affiliates to terminate employment with, or cease providing Services to, Aduro or its affiliates.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an inconsistency by reducing the non-solicitation period to six months, which contradicts the initially defined Restricted Period of twelve months, potentially leading to disputes over the enforceability of the non-solicitation clause.
